translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty

analyzed: navama vagga  rūpa sa ārammaṇa anti kathā
translated: The ninth section🔽Discussion of form as a sense object
Is form a sense object?

original: Āmantā.🔽Atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo samannāhāro manasikāro cetanā patthanā paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽nanu natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Āmantā.
analyzed: āmantā  atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo samannāhāraḥ manasikāro cetanā patthanā paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nanu natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti  āmantā
translated: You have said that.

original: Hañci natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhi, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“rūpaṁ sārammaṇan”ti.🔽Phasso sārammaṇo, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: hañci natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi no ca vata re vattabbe  rūpam  phassaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti
translated: Is there a turning towards, a grasping, a taking hold of, a directing of attention to, an intention, a resolve, a decision, a choice, a preference, a longing, a desire, an aspiration, a search, a pursuit, a striving, an endeavour, an exertion, an attempt, a procedure, a means, a method, a way, a path, a route, a track, a course, a channel, a stream, a flood, a torrent, a hurricane, a whirlpool, a quagmire, a bog, a quagmire of views, a quagmire of craving, a quagmire of conceit, a quagmire of wrong views, a quagmire of doubt, a quagmire of views about the past and future, a quagmire of views about the self, a quagmire of views about the world, a quagmire of views about the world and the self, a quagmire of views about the world and the self and the past and future, a quagmire of views about the self and the past and future, a quagmire of views about the self, the world, the past and future?

original: Āmantā.🔽Rūpaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Vedanā …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  rūpam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  vedanā pe
translated: You have said that.

original: saññā cetanā cittaṁ saddhā vīriyaṁ sati samādhi paññā rāgo doso moho māno diṭṭhi vicikicchā thinaṁ uddhaccaṁ ahirikaṁ …pe…

original: anottappaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: anottappam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti
translated: Is lack of conscience the object of that which is the basis, the instigation, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the aiming, the bent of the mind, the exertion of energy?
“Yes.”

original: Rūpaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form the object of that which is the basis, the instigation, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the aiming, the bent of the mind, the exertion of energy?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

original: Rūpaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam sa ārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form not the object of that which is the basis, the instigation, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the aiming, the bent of the mind, the exertion of energy?”
“Yes.”

original: Phasso sārammaṇo, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: phassaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ na atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is contact the object of that which is not the basis, the instigation, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the aiming, the bent of the mind, the exertion of energy?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Rūpaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam sa ārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form the object of that which is not the basis, the instigation, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the aiming, the bent of the mind, the exertion of energy?”
“Yes.”

original: anottappaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogo …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: anottappam sa ārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā ābhogaḥ pe paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is lack of conscience the object of that which is not the basis, the instigation, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the aiming, the bent of the mind, the exertion of energy?”🔽“No.”
“It should not be said that
‘form is the object.’
“Yes.”
“Isn’t it the case that form has a condition?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci rūpaṁ sappaccayaṁ, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci rūpam sappaccaya tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “Then it is proper to say that
‘form is the object.’“

analyzed: rūpam sa ārammaṇa anti kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of “Form is the Object” is finished.
